subclusters.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Control and Dynamics Theory
Mitochondrial ROS and Oxidative Damage Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Control and Dynamics Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial quality control pathways including mitophagy, fusion/fission dynamics, and mitochondrial-derived vesicles maintaining mitochondrial homeostasis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Control and Dynamics Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondrial dynamics (fusion, fission), mitophagy, and quality control as central to aging and mitochondrial dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Control and Dynamics Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial quality control mechanisms in T cells including mitophagy and dynamics affecting aging and immune function.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Control and Dynamics Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Incorporates mitochondrial quality control via mitophagy and mitochondrial dynamics (fusion/fission) as key regulators of aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Control and Dynamics Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitonuclear communication, mitochondrial quality control, and signaling pathways maintaining mitochondrial and cellular homeostasis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Control and Dynamics Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes altered mitochondrial mass, mitophagy, and bioenergetics changes in stem cells linked to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Control and Dynamics Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details mitochondrial bioenergetics dysfunction, redox imbalance, and quality control defects contributing to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Control and Dynamics Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights impaired mitochondrial fusion-fission cycles and mitonuclear interactions affecting mitochondrial function and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Signaling Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondria as signaling organelles and how disruption of mitochondrial signaling pathways drives aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on mitochondrial ROS production causing oxidative damage to mtDNA and proteins, leading to dysfunction and apoptosis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondrial oxidative stress causing DNA damage, cellular senescence, and aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes Complex I deficiency increasing mitochondrial superoxide production leading to apoptosis and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS damage in oocytes causing mtDNA mutations, apoptosis, and aging-related decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights ROS production and oxidative damage accumulation in mitochondria as fundamental causes of aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links mitochondrial oxidative stress and dysfunction to aging phenotypes in genetic diseases and progeroid syndromes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial dysfunction and ROS accumulation causing a vicious cycle of damage leading to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on Complex I H+ pumping inhibition causing maximal superoxide production and oxidative stress driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on accumulation of mtDNA mutations with age causing mitochondrial dysfunction and tissue-specific aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Posits mtDNA mutations in respiratory chain genes cause catalytic deficiency and mitochondrial respiratory decline with aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes somatic mtDNA mutation accumulation impairing electron transport and causing mitochondrial dysfunction in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes mtDNA mutation accumulation causes mitochondrial respiratory dysfunction and aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-dependent accumulation of large mtDNA deletions impairing respiratory function and contributing to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mosaic accumulation of mtDNA deletions in aging skeletal muscle leading to respiratory dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Attributes mtDNA mutations mainly to replication errors by mitochondrial DNA polymerase gamma, accumulating with age.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links age-related decline in OXPHOS to accumulation of mtDNA damage and mutations impairing mitochondrial function.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes respiration-dependent ROS production causing mtDNA damage and mitochondrial decline contributing to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS causing oxidative damage in lysosomes leading to lipofuscin accumulation and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links mitochondrial dysfunction and ROS accumulation to brain aging and Alzheimer's disease pathology.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: CLK-1/MCLK1 Mitochondrial Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial enzyme CLK-1/MCLK1 role in ubiquinone biosynthesis and aging modulation via mitochondrial function.
